text: hello my name is Brendan Paul and today
I'll be talking about deep instance
inspection for Amazon ec2 instances with
Amazon inspector
Amazon inspector is a vulnerability
Management Service that continually
scans your AWS workloads for software
vulnerabilities and unintended Network
exposure
inspector automatically discovers and
scans running ec2 instances container
images and Amazon elastic container
registry and AWS Lambda functions
inspector creates a finding when it
discovers a software vulnerability or
network configuration issue
a finding describes the vulnerability
identifies the affected resource writes
the severity of the vulnerability and
provides remediation guidance
you can analyze findings using the
Amazon inspector console or View and
process your findings through other AWS
services
now let's dive into the deep inspection
feature of Amazon inspector
with the Deep inspection feature
inspector identifies software
vulnerabilities in application
programming packages including python
Java and node.js packages in addition to
operating system packages
inspector discovers these application
programming packages installed in
default directory paths and also allows
customers to provide additional custom
directory passed for inspector discovery
this feature is activated by default for
all new customers and existing customers
can activate this feature across their
organization with a single click in the
console
deep inspection of ec2 instances is
offered at no additional cost to
existing inspector customers
lastly inspector performed steep
inspection scans using data collected
from an Amazon inspector SSM plugin and
the service collects updated application
inventory from instances for deep
inspection every six hours
now let's jump over to the console and
see how we can use this Amazon inspector
feature
deep inspection is activated by default
for all new inspector customers
existing customers can activate this
feature across their organization with a
single click in the console
if you are an existing customer to see
the status of your accounts you can
navigate to the account management
window
from there you will see a list of your
AWS accounts and whether or not they
have the feature enabled
accounts which do not have deep
inspection enabled will have a note
under Amazon ec2 scanning which says
deep inspection deactivated
if you activated Amazon inspector before
April 17 2023 you can activate deep
inspection through the console Banner or
through the API
in this case we'll use the console
Banner to activate this feature
as you can see we have enabled the Deep
inspection feature and we will wait for
inspector to start scanning our
instances
now that inspector has had some time to
scan my ec2 instances let's review a
finding if I navigate to an ec2 instance
and look at the findings you will see
that there are a number of application
package vulnerabilities found
we'll examine the one in the python JWT
module
python JWT is a module for generating
and verifying Json web tokens
we see here that versions prior to 3.3.4
are subject to authentication bypass
attacks
we also see that the severity of this
finding is critical and some of the
details about the last known public
exploit
we can see what version the package was
fixed in and the file path for the
finding
we can also see some details about the
vulnerability and the ec2 instance that
this vulnerability was found on
now that we've looked at an application
package vulnerability let's see how we
can create custom paths in inspector
I'll first navigate to ec2 scanning
settings
all accounts can Define up to five
custom paths for their individual
account
if you're the delegated administrator
for your organization you can Define
five additional paths that will apply
across your entire organization
this amounts to a total of 10 custom
paths scanned per account in the
organization
Amazon inspector scans all custom paths
in addition to the following default
paths that are scanned for all accounts
finally I'll go ahead and add a third
custom path to this account and select
save
in this video we talked about the
ability to do deep inspection of ec2
instances with Amazon inspector
we looked at how you can enable this
feature with one click if you are
already in Amazon inspector customer and
showed an example of an application
package finding that this feature
enables
if you'd like to learn more about Amazon
inspector check out some of the links
below the video or the AWS documentation
